Patient Particulars: Name: Ann; Sex: Female; Marital status: Married
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Desire to take Percocet drug
2. Difficulty in controlling intake of drug
3. Tolerance of dosage of the drug 
4. Difficulty sustaining concentration
History: Present history: Patient has been seeking treatment from last 6 months to quit on her drug consuming habit; Past history: She used to indulge in gambling; Substance use history: She has been taking Percocet drug.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport was established and patient was cooperative; Mood: Anxious; Affect: Restricted; Thought: Content: reflected stress about quitting the drug and reduced confidence; Judgement: Personal judgement was impaired.
Psychotherapy Type: Type: Supportive psychotherapy; Mode of therapy: Individual
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient expressed her inability to concentrate well on her work. She also feels shameful knowing that her co-workers might have started noticing her drug intake. She is willing to quit on this habits of hers but is struggling with it.
Action Plan: Patient has been told to reflect her strengths, support system and her past successes.
